head.title: On the Brink of Mideast Change

hedline.hl1: On the Brink of Mideast Change

abstract.p: Josh Trevers letter replies to William Safire's June 1 column, which expressed fear that conceding to Palestinians land in Jordan Valley and civil control of parts of East Jerusalem would endanger Israel's security

block.p: William Safire (column, June 1) fears that Israeli concessions to the Palestinians of land in the Jordan Valley and of civil control of parts of East Jerusalem will be a danger to Israeli security and will threaten the existence of Jordan's Hashemite regime. Yet a Palestinian police force in control of 90 percent of the West Bank poses little threat either to the Israeli or Jordanian Armies.

William Safire (column, June 1) fears that Israeli concessions to the Palestinians of land in the Jordan Valley and of civil control of parts of East Jerusalem will be a danger to Israeli security and will threaten the existence of Jordan's Hashemite regime. Yet a Palestinian police force in control of 90 percent of the West Bank poses little threat either to the Israeli or Jordanian Armies.

The real threat to Israeli security will be the potential for renewed terrorist attacks if an agreement is not reached that is supported by the majority of the Palestinian people. No doubt such an agreement will require Israel to withdraw from most of the West Bank and to compromise on the status of Jerusalem.
